source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Portulacaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Portulacaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Seed distinctly tuberculate, dull or shining, 0.6–1.2 mm diam.; mature capsule up to 2 mm long; flowers both solitary and in clusters or all clustered
Seed virtually smooth, shining, 1.3–1.8 mm diam.; mature capsule c. 2.5 mm long; flowers all or mostly solitary in axils
Tubercles of several dorsal rows ± conical, those on the sides elongated and less raised; seed 0.6–1 mm diam.
Tubercles dorsally rounded, virtually equal in size, shape and distribution all over seed; seed 0.8–1.2 mm diam.
